title: Unconquered Lands and Eastern Inheritance
summary: Joshua 13 notes that Joshua is old and there is still land to be conquered. God instructs him to begin dividing the land. The chapter lists territories east of the Jordan already given to Reuben, Gad, and half of Manasseh.

faq.question: What does God tell Joshua even though he is old?
faq.answer: That there is still land to possess, and it must be allocated.

faq.question: Which tribes inherited land east of the Jordan?
faq.answer: Reuben, Gad, and the half-tribe of Manasseh.
